The misleading Facebook post includes a: s President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, along with a Sinhala-language text at the top left-hand corner congratulating them on eradicating corona from Lanka.
The Sinhala: language caption of the post translates to English as: “What became of Shavendra Silva, Ajith Rohana and Anil Jasinghe / This is what happened to the war victory too”. This implies a connection between the individuals mentioned and the COVID-19 eradication claim.
A reverse image search on Google reveale: 2019. The photo was credited to AFP and shows supporters of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) party presidential candidate Gotabaya Rajapaksa carrying cut-out placards to celebrate his victory in the presidential elections.
The expert: s verdict states that the claims made in the misleading posts are false, as Sri Lanka has not eradicated COVID-19 according to data published by the Health Promotion Bureau. The bureau reported 889 confirmed cases, nine deaths, 117 suspected and hospitalized cases, and 366 recovered and discharged cases as of May 13, 2020.
